tools.name: Django Cookiecutter Wagtail
tools.description: A Django Cookiecutter template with Wagtail. Based on the original 'Django Cookiecutter'. Features: Docker support using `docker-compose` for development and production (using Traefik with LetsEncrypt support), customizable PostgreSQL version, Bootstrap 4, media storage using Amazon S3 or Google Cloud Storage and many more.

resources.name: Getting started in Wagtail, a newcomer's perspective
resources.description: Having used Drupal almost exclusively as my main tool of choice for a while now, I was asked to put together a build using Wagtail. By [@kiwimind](https://twitter.com/kiwimind).

resources.name: Présentation de Wagtail, le dernier CMS Django
resources.description: Wagtail est un CMS relativement récent dans l’écosystème Django. Pour autant, son jeune âge ne l’empêche pas de posséder de nombreuses fonctionnalités que nous découvrirons dans cet article.

resources.name: Getting Started With Wagtail
resources.description: Working extensively with Wagtail and the surrounding community, we have discovered a range of common pitfalls developers run into when beginning to deliver with Wagtail.

resources.name: DjangoCon US 2015 - Wagtail - Yet Another Django CMS
resources.description: Tom Dyson - Tom will explain why his agency decided to build a new CMS, share some lessons learned in running a growing open source project, and outline Wagtail's roadmap to version 2 and beyond. [Slide deck](https://speakerdeck.com/tomdyson/wagtail-yet-another-cms-djangocon-us-2015).

resources.name: Wellington Wagtail CMS Meetup - Meet Wagtail
resources.description: Josh, Jordi and Rich, from the Springload dev team - An introductory session to Wagtail to showcase the main features it has to offer.

resources.name: DjangoCon US 2016 - Atomic Wagtail
resources.description: Kurt Wall – Brad Frost's atomic design principles are taking the way we design the web by storm. I'll explain what Wagtail is, how you can use it with atomic design principles, and some hurdles you might run into along the way with suggestions on how to help.

resources.name: PyCon Australia – Comparing Wagtail, Django CMS and Mezzanine
resources.description: Adam Brenecki – This talk explores the different approaches, strengths and weaknesses of each CMS, and what they mean for you as a developer and for your content editors.

resources.description: Mikalai Radchuk - This talk is an introduction to Wagtail in Russian.

Podcast.__init__ Episode 58 - Wagtail with Tom Dyson
resources.description: In this episode Tom Dyson explains how Wagtail came to be created, what sets it apart from other options, and when you should implement it for your projects.

resources.name: Django Chat: Wagtail CMS - Tom Dyson
resources.description: An interview with Tom Dyson on Wagtail, the leading Django-based CMS used by tens of thousands of organizations including Google, NASA, and the British NHS.

resources.name: Wagtail Wednesdays #01 - Adding Help Text to Improve Wagtail Editor Experience

resources.name: Wagtail Wednesdays #02 - Customising Rich Text Features in Wagtail
resources.description: Catherine talks you through the steps you can take to customise your rich text editors to control which features are available to your content editors.

resources.name: Wagtail Wednesdays #03 - Using tabs to create a cleaner admin interface
resources.description: Chris talks you through using tabs to organise fields.

resources.name: Wagtail Wednesdays #04 - Organising Images and Documents using Wagtail Collections
resources.description: Kieran talks you through the process of organising your images and documents into collections.

resources.name: Wagtail Wednesdays #05 - How to organise your fields and streamline the editor experience
resources.description: Chelsea talks you through the process of organising your fields to make it easier to manage them and streamline the editor experience.

resources.name: Wagtail Wednesdays #06 - Creating & using custom settings in your wagtail site
resources.description: Chris talks you through setting up and using custom site settings.

resources.name: Wagtail Wednesdays #07 - How to Enable the Wagtail Styleguide
resources.description: It’s a really helpful resource that takes no time at all to enable and it allows you to check your components against the guidelines and shows all the available Wagtail icons.
